reasoning: Materials' strong momentum and improving profitability, coupled with macro tailwinds from rising inflation, support a long view. Consumer Staples' relatively weaker performance and sensitivity to inflation make it a suitable short candidate.

Industrials' strong momentum and economic sensitivity make it a good long candidate, while Real Estate's relatively weaker performance and sensitivity to interest rates make it a suitable short candidate.

Energy's strong momentum and improving profitability, coupled with macro tailwinds from rising oil prices, support a long view. Utilities' relatively weaker performance and sensitivity to interest rates make it a suitable short candidate.

Financials' strong momentum and improving profitability, coupled with macro tailwinds from rising rates, support a long view. Health Care's relatively weaker performance and sensitivity to regulatory changes make it a suitable short candidate.

Consumer Discretionary's relatively weaker performance and sensitivity to economic cycles make it a suitable short candidate. Information Technology's strong momentum and improving profitability, coupled with macro tailwinds from rising demand, support a long view.
